Module Simulator
Package kin.env

Class Environment

java.lang.Object
kin.env.Environment
All Implemented Interfaces:
Evaluator
public class Environment
extends java.lang.Object
implements Evaluator
Global settings and object in the virtual environment.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Constructor Details

    • Environment

      public Environment​(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String[] robotConfiguration) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Create an environment from file.
      Parameters:
      filename - file name
      robotConfiguration - strings of option -robot<nr>, if available, null otherwise
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if file is not accessible
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file cannot be parsed

  • Method Details

    • countRobots

      public int countRobots()
      Number of specified robots, even 1, if no MULTIROBOT directive was specified.
      Returns:
      number of robots

    • getBorders

      public double[] getBorders()
      Get the borders as specified in the environment file.
      Returns:
      border as array {borderMinX,borderMinY,borderMaxX,borderMaxY}

    • resetAllBalls

      public void resetAllBalls()
      Reset all balls' states to the original states when initializing the environment. I.e., the positions are the one from the environment file and velocites are zero.

    • resetAllCuboids

      public void resetAllCuboids()
      Reset all cuboids' states to the original states when initializing the environment. I.e., the positions are the one from the environment file.

    • resetAllConveyors

      public void resetAllConveyors()
      Reset all conveyors' states to the original states when initializing the environment. I.e., the initial running states are restored.
